# Issue 19987: Auto-generated PARI functions sometimes return 0 instead of None

archive/issues_019987.json:
```json
{
    "body": "When removing the manual `default()` method:\n\n```\nsage: pari.default(\"factor_proven\", 1)\n0\n```\n\nThis really should not return anything, which means returning `None` in Python.\n\nIssue created by migration from https://trac.sagemath.org/ticket/20224\n\n",
    "created_at": "2016-03-16T17:15:31Z",
    "labels": [
        "interfaces",
        "minor",
        "bug"
    ],
    "milestone": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/milestones/sage-7.2",
    "title": "Auto-generated PARI functions sometimes return 0 instead of None",
    "type": "issue",
    "url": "https://github.com/sagemath/sagetest/issues/19987",
    "user": "@jdemeyer"
}
```
When removing the manual `default()` method:

```
sage: pari.default("factor_proven", 1)
0
```

This really should not return anything, which means returning `None` in Python.

Issue created by migration from https://trac.sagemath.org/ticket/20224
